titlepage.titleproper: Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records, 1931-1999
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1981-094

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records, 1931-1999

physloc.label: Location
physloc.emph: Note: This collection is in off-site storage and requires 2-3 days notice for retrieval. Please contact Special Collections for more information.

did.abstract: The Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records include correspondence (including some correspondence antedating the founding of the VJAS); notes and minutes from committees and general meetings, reports, publications, memorabilia, and subject files.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records, Ms1981-094, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The intial Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records were donated to Special Collections in 1981. Additional donations occurred through 1999.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Virginia Junior Academy of Science Records commenced in September 1998 and was completed in March 1999. Additional description was completed in February 2010.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Academy of Science (VAS) organized the first Virginia Junior Academy of Science (VJAS) meeting in 1941, after several years of discussions about how best to discover and promote scientific aptitude in the secondary schools of Virginia. Though the VJAS ceased to meet during World War II, it was reorganized after the war. Beginning in 1946, the VAS sponsored a statewide science competition for high school students known as the Virginia Science Talent Search. Since 1952, a VJAS newspaper (the Junior Science Bulletin) has been published; and since 1963 the Virginia Junior Academy of Science Proceedings have served as a record of papers presented at VJAS meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Virginia Junior Academy of Science Archives include correspondence (including some correspondence antedating the founding of the VJAS); notes and minutes from committees and general meetings, reports, publications, memorabilia, and miscellaneous files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by chronologically in subject files.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Virginia Academy of Science Records, 1920-1999, Ms1981-096. Finding aid available online. Note: This collection is in off-site storage and requires 2-3 days notice for retrieval. Please contact Special Collections for more information.
